hanzi-su-wiki:
鉛

Значения

Свинец

Мнемоника

Металл 金 цвета придонной грязи. Добывается там, где русло 口 делится 八 на отдельные потоки. Свинец — тяжёлый металл и не уносится водой.

Варианты

铅

鉛(なまり): lead (the metal)
鉛筆(えんぴつ): pencil
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You hold gold fins in your mouth while shopping for pencil lead at the store. This pencil lead store only accepts gold fins as payment, but your fins don’t fit in your pockets and you need your hands to carry the lead so the gold fins go in your mouth.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine having these gold fins in your mouth. Taste the metal as your tongue runs over them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You pay for your lead but the cashier puts it in your mouth where the gold fins were and... everything ends (えん).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Lead poisoning, huh? What a way for everything to end...
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 并, 口 (рот), 金 (золото)

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) for the eight mouths (㕣) is lead
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: It sounds crazy but when I was a kid I chewed on so many pencils that I started to belch lead. Then I switched to chewing on metal pens.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " gold " and "㕣", the original meaning is blue-gray, soft, heavy, malleable, and easy to oxidize. The ancients often called it green gold or tin. Its main purpose is to manufacture alloys, storage batteries, cable sheaths and equipment for shielding gamma rays. "Shu Wen": "Green and gold. From gold, 㕣 sound." "Shu‧Yugong": "Daiyingsi, 枲, 鈆, pine, strange stone." Kong Yingdashu: "鈆, tin also."

" Lead " can mean lead powder. Five Dynasties Ma Jian "Chinese Ancient and Modern Notes‧ Powder": "Since the three generations, lead has been used as powder. Qin Mu's daughter has made jade, has Rong De, touches the history of immortal Xiao, used to burn mercury as powder and paint, also known as Feixue Dan, passed down With the flute, the song rises at the end."

" Lead " can also refer specifically to lead chalk. Tang Hanyu "Qiu Huai": "It's better to look at the text, and investigate the matter of Danqi."

" Lead " can also be compared to dull aptitude. Tang Zhang Jiuling, "Dengjun Chengnan Tower": "Although the lead is self-inspiring, the warehouse is not real."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " gold " and "㕣", the original meaning is blue-gray, soft, heavy, malleable, and easy to oxidize. The ancients often called it green gold or tin.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「㕣」聲，本義為青灰色，質軟而重，有延展性，容易氧化的金屬，古人常稱之為青金或錫。其主要用途是製造合金、蓄電池、電纜的外皮和屏蔽丙種射線的裝備。《說文》：「青金也。从金，㕣聲。」 《書‧禹貢》：「岱畎絲、枲、鈆、松、怪石。」孔穎達疏：「鈆，錫也。」

　　「鉛」可表示鉛粉。五代馬縞《中華古今注‧粉》：「自三代以鉛為粉。秦穆公女弄玉，有容德，感僊人簫史，為燒水銀作粉與塗，亦名飛雪丹，傳以簫，曲終而同上昇。」

　　「鉛」也可特指鉛粉筆。唐韓愈〈秋懷〉：「不如覷文字，丹鉛事點勘。」

　　「鉛」還可比喻資質魯鈍。唐張九齡〈登郡城南樓〉：「駑鉛雖自勉，倉廩素非實。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「㕣」聲，本義為青灰色，質軟而重，有延展性，容易氧化的金屬，古人常稱之為青金或錫。

①一種金屬元素，可用作耐硫酸腐蝕、防丙種射線、蓄電池等的材料。其合金可作鉛字、軸承、電纜包皮等之用：鉛刀(指鈍刀子，喻才能微薄)。鉛球。
②指用石墨等製成的書寫工具：鉛筆。鉛槧(鉛粉筆和木板，古人用以書寫的工具，借指著作校勘)。

從「 金 」，「 㕣 」聲，本義為青灰色，質軟而重，有延展性，容易氧化的金屬，古人常稱之為青金或錫。其主要用途是製造合金、蓄電池、電纜的外皮和屏蔽丙種射線的裝備。《說文》：「青金也。从金，㕣聲。」 《書‧禹貢》：「岱畎絲、枲、鈆、松、怪石。」孔穎達疏：「鈆，錫也。」 「 鉛 」可表示鉛粉。五代馬縞《中華古今注‧粉》：「自三代以鉛為粉。秦穆公女弄玉，有容德，感僊人簫史，為燒水銀作粉與塗，亦名飛雪丹，傳以簫，曲終而同上昇。」 「 鉛 」也可特指鉛粉筆。唐韓愈〈秋懷〉：「不如覷文字，丹鉛事點勘。」 「 鉛 」還可比喻資質魯鈍。唐張九齡〈登郡城南樓〉：「駑鉛雖自勉，倉廩素非實。」
From the sound of " gold" and " 㕣", the original meaning is blue-gray, soft, heavy, malleable, and easy to oxidize. The ancients often called it green gold or tin. Its main purpose is to manufacture alloys, storage batteries, cable sheaths and equipment for shielding gamma rays. "Shu Wen": "Green and gold. From gold, 㕣 sound." "Shu‧Yugong": "Daiyingsi, 枲, 鈆, pine, strange stone." Kong Yingdashu: "鈆, tin also." " Lead" can mean lead powder. Five Dynasties Ma Jian "Chinese Ancient and Modern Notes‧ Powder": "Since the three generations, lead has been used as powder. Qin Mu's daughter has made jade, has Rong De, touches the history of immortal Xiao, used to burn mercury as powder and paint, also known as Feixue Dan, passed down With the flute, the song rises at the end." " Lead" can also refer specifically to lead chalk. Tang Hanyu "Qiu Huai": "It's better to look at the text, and investigate the matter of Danqi." " Lead" can also be compared to dull aptitude. Tang Zhang Jiuling, "Dengjun Chengnan Tower": "Although the lead is self-inspiring, the warehouse is not real."

鉛字的基本解释

鉛
qiān

鉛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiān］
［《廣韻》與專切，平仙，以。］
“铅1”的繁体字。亦作“鈆1”。
(1)金属元素，符号Pb。青灰色，质软而重，有延展性，容易氧化。主要用途是制造合金、蓄电池、电缆的外皮和屏蔽丙种射线的装备。古人常将铅称为青金或锡。
(2)指铅粉。
(3)铅粉笔。古时用以点校书文或绘画。
(4)用黑铅（石墨）或加入带颜料的黏土做的笔芯。参见“鉛筆”。
(5)比喻资质鲁钝。
(6)道教所谓的在人体内运行的气。
[②]［yán］
“铅2”的繁体字。同“沿1”。
依循。

鉛字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鉛； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1301第18
【唐韻】與專切【集韻】【韻會】余專切，?音沿。【說文】靑金也。【玉篇】黑錫也。【正字通】錫類。生蜀郡平澤，今銀坑處皆有之。一名黑錫。錫白，故鉛爲黑錫。李時珍曰：鉛，易沿流，故謂之鉛。【書·禹貢】鉛松怪石。【寶藏論】鉛有數種，波斯鉛堅白，爲第一。草節鉛出犍爲，銀之精也。銜銀鉛，銀坑中之鉛，內含五色。上饒、樂平鉛次之，負版鉛鐵苗也。獨孤滔曰：雅州釣腳鉛，形如皁莢，大如蝌蚪子，黑色，生沙中，亦可乾汞。　又鉛粉，亦名胡粉。卽鉛華也。【曹植·洛神賦】鉛華勿御。【正字通】鉛粉，卽今化鉛所成。一曰粉錫，非以錫爲之，其法縣鉛塊于酒缸中，封閉四十九日，鉛化爲粉，不白者，炒爲黃丹。蘇恭謂炒錫造之，朱震亨謂胡粉乃錫粉，以陶弘景化鉛之說爲誤，?非也。　又縣名。【唐書·地理志】信州鉛山縣。　又與延同。人名。【前漢·古今人表】鉛陵卓子。　又【正韻】循也。【荀子·榮辱篇】鉛之重之。【註】謂撫循之申重之也。

鉛字的源字形

小篆楷体

暂无。

lead
Basic explanation of words
lead
qiān
lead
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiān］
["Guangyun" and Zhuanqie, Pingxian, to. ]
"Lead 1" in traditional characters. Also known as "鈆1".
(1) Metal element, symbol Pb. Cyan-gray, soft and heavy, malleable and easy to oxidize. The main purpose is to manufacture alloys, batteries, cable sheaths and equipment for shielding gamma rays. The ancients often referred to lead as green gold or tin.
(2) Refers to lead powder.
(3) Lead chalk. In ancient times, it was used to read texts or paintings.
(4) Refill made of black lead (graphite) or clay with pigment. See "pencil".
(5) Metaphor of dull aptitude.
(6) Taoist so-called Qi that runs in the human body.
[②]［yán］
"Lead 2" in traditional characters. Same as "edge 1".
Follow.
lead
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Su Ji 1】【Golden Word Department】　Lead; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1301 Page 18
[Tang Yun] and special cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] more special cut, sound along. [Said the text] Qian Jin also. [Jade articles] Black tin also. [Zhengzitong] Tin type. Pingze, Shengshu County, is found in Yinkeng today. A black tin. Tin is white, so lead is black tin. Li Shizhen said: Lead is easy to flow along, so it is called lead. 【Book·Yugong】The lead pine rock. [Treasure Theory] There are several kinds of lead, and Persian lead is strong and white, which is the first. The lead from the grass knot is the essence of silver. Silver lead, the lead in the silver pit, contains five colors. Shangrao and Leping lead second, and the negative lead iron seedlings are also. Dugu Tao said: Yazhou fishing foot lead, shaped like a honey locust, as big as a tadpole, black, in the raw sand, and can also be dry mercury.　Lead powder, also known as Hu powder. Also lead Hua. [Cao Zhi·Luo Shen Fu] Do not imperial lead to China. 【Zhengzitong】Lead powder, made by today's lead. First, powder tin is not made of tin. The lead block of the law county is placed in a wine jar and closed for 49 days. The lead turns into powder, and the one that is not white is fried into yellow pill. Su Gong said that it was made by fried tin, and Zhu Zhenheng said that Hu powder is tin powder. It is wrong to say that Tao Hongjinghua lead.　Also the county name. [Book of Tang·Geography] Jianshan County, Xinzhou.　And Yantong again. Person's name. [Former Han · Ancient and Modern People's Form] Qianling Zhuozi.　 [Zheng Yun] Xun Ye. [Xunzi: Honor and Disgrace Chapter] The weight of lead. [Note] It is also the Shen Zhongzhi of Fuxun.
